paper_abstract: Knowledge-based or Artificial Intelligence techniques are used increasingly as alternatives to more classical techniques to model environmental systems. We review some of them and their environmental applicability, with examples and a reference list. The techniques covered are case-based reasoning, rule-based systems, artificial neural networks, fuzzy models, genetic algorithms, cellular automata, multi-agent systems, swarm intelligence, reinforcement learning and hybrid systems. (C) 2008 IMACS. Published by Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Artificial Intelligence techniques: An introduction to their use for modelling environmental systems
